title: Drawing, "A fish peddler.  A gentleman.", ca. 1625–50
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: At left: a peddler, in his right hand a pail and in his left hand a basket with fish, and d a pair of scales.  He is walking toward the right, shown from the front.  The gentleman is walking toward the left, shown in profile.  He wears low shoes, stockings, a hat with a feather and a sword.  He is wrapped in a cloak.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "A fish peddler.  A gentleman.", ca. 1625–50.
ca. 1625–50. Pen and ink on paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7281.
